intro: Planchonella lamii, commonly known as the giant pandanus, is a flowering plant native to the Indo-Pacific region. It is characterized by its large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in panicles, which are typically followed by woody, three-angled fruits. Planchonella lamii thrives in coastal and tropical environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitats.
